storyTitle: As Employee, I want to filter my schedule by shift type to focus on relevant shifts

testCases.title: Validate shift type filter application
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee is logged into the portal with valid credentials
Employee has multiple shifts assigned with different shift types (morning, afternoon, night)
Employee is on the schedule view page
Shift type filter options are visible and accessible

steps.action: Locate the shift type filter dropdown/checkbox section on the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Shift type filter options (Morning, Afternoon, Night) are displayed and available for selection

steps.action: Click or select the 'Morning' shift filter option
steps.expectedResult: The 'Morning' filter is visually marked as selected (checked/highlighted) and the schedule view updates within 2 seconds to display only shifts with shift type 'Morning'. All other shift types are hidden from view

steps.action: While 'Morning' filter is still active, click or select the 'Night' shift filter option in addition to the existing selection
steps.expectedResult: Both 'Morning' and 'Night' filters are visually marked as selected. The schedule view updates within 2 seconds to display shifts with shift types 'Morning' and 'Night' only. Afternoon shifts remain hidden

steps.action: Click the 'Clear filters' button or deselect all active shift type filters
steps.expectedResult: All shift type filters are deselected/unchecked. The schedule view updates within 2 seconds to display the full schedule showing all shift types (Morning, Afternoon, and Night shifts)

postconditions: All filters are cleared and the full schedule is displayed
The schedule view shows all shift types without any active filters
The system is ready for the next filter operation

testCases.title: Test filter persistence during navigation
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee is logged into the portal with valid credentials
Employee has shifts scheduled across multiple weeks
Employee is on the schedule view page showing the current week
Shift type filter options are visible and accessible
Schedule navigation controls (next week/previous week) are available

steps.action: Select the 'Morning' shift type filter from the available filter options
steps.expectedResult: The 'Morning' filter is marked as selected and the schedule view updates within 2 seconds to display only morning shifts for the current week

steps.action: Verify the filtered schedule is displaying correctly with only morning shifts visible
steps.expectedResult: Only shifts with shift type 'Morning' are displayed in the schedule view. Other shift types are not visible

steps.action: Click the 'Next Week' navigation button or arrow to move to the following week's schedule
steps.expectedResult: The schedule view navigates to the next week and the 'Morning' filter remains active (still visually selected). The schedule displays only morning shifts for the next week within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the filter state is maintained and the correct filtered data is displayed for the new week
steps.expectedResult: The 'Morning' filter indicator remains selected/highlighted. Only morning shifts for the next week are displayed. The filter has persisted through the navigation action

postconditions: The shift type filter remains active after navigation
The schedule displays the next week with the filter still applied
The filter state is maintained in the system session
The employee can continue navigating with the filter active or clear it as needed

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to search my schedule by date to quickly find specific shifts

testCases.title: Validate schedule search with valid date
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee is logged into the portal with valid credentials
Employee has shifts scheduled on various dates
Employee is on the schedule view page
Date search field/date picker is visible and accessible
At least one shift exists on the date that will be searched

steps.action: Locate the date search field or date picker input on the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: The date search field or date picker is displayed and ready for input

steps.action: Enter a valid date in the correct format (e.g., MM/DD/YYYY or select from date picker) for a date that has scheduled shifts
steps.expectedResult: The date is accepted and displayed in the search field without any validation errors

steps.action: Submit the search by clicking the search button or pressing Enter
steps.expectedResult: The system processes the search within 2 seconds and displays only the shifts scheduled for the entered date. The schedule view updates to show the search results with shift details (time, type, location) for that specific date

steps.action: Verify that only shifts for the searched date are displayed and belong to the logged-in employee
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts match the searched date and are assigned to the logged-in employee only. No shifts from other dates or other employees are shown

steps.action: Click the 'Clear search' button or clear the date input field
steps.expectedResult: The date search field is cleared and the schedule view returns to the full schedule display showing all upcoming shifts across all dates

postconditions: The search is cleared and the full schedule view is restored
The date search field is empty and ready for a new search
All employee shifts are visible in the default schedule view

testCases.title: Verify handling of invalid date input
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee is logged into the portal with valid credentials
Employee is on the schedule view page
Date search field/date picker is visible and accessible
System has defined valid date format requirements

steps.action: Locate the date search field on the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: The date search field is displayed and ready for input

steps.action: Enter an invalid date format in the search field (e.g., '99/99/9999', 'abc123', '13/45/2024', or other malformed date)
steps.expectedResult: The system detects the invalid date format

steps.action: Attempt to submit the search by clicking the search button or pressing Enter
steps.expectedResult: The search is blocked and not executed. A clear error message is displayed indicating 'Invalid date format. Please enter a valid date (MM/DD/YYYY)' or similar. The schedule view remains unchanged

steps.action: Clear the invalid input and enter a valid date that is outside the employee's schedule range (e.g., a date far in the past before employment or far in the future beyond scheduled shifts)
steps.expectedResult: The date format is accepted as valid

steps.action: Submit the search for the out-of-range date
steps.expectedResult: The system processes the search within 2 seconds and displays an informative message 'No shifts found for the selected date' or similar. The message is clear and non-technical. No error styling is shown, just an informational message

steps.action: Verify that the schedule view shows the 'No shifts found' message without displaying any shift data
steps.expectedResult: The schedule area displays only the informative message. No shifts are shown. The interface remains functional and the employee can perform another search

postconditions: The system has properly validated and handled invalid date inputs
Appropriate error or informational messages were displayed
The schedule view remains stable without crashes or unexpected behavior
The date search field is ready for new valid input
